column1: Taylors Falls is a city in Chisago County
column4: located at the junction of U.S. Highway 8 and Minnesota State Highway 95.  The population was 976 at the 2010 census.

column1: Taylors Falls was platted in 1850 or 1851
column2: and incorporated in 1858. The city was named for Jesse Taylor
column3: a territorial politician. A post office has been in operation in Taylors Falls since 1851. During the logging era
column4: Taylors Falls was the site of numerous log jams
column5: most notably the 1886 St. Croix river log jam

column1: According to the United States Census Bureau
column2: the city has a total area of 4.39 square miles (11.37 km2)
column4: 4.10 square miles (10.62 km2) is land and 0.29 square miles (0.75 km2) is water.Taylors Falls is located adjacent to St. Croix Falls
column6: at the Dalles of the St. Croix River
column7: an area of forested bluffs and high cliffs.  The first interstate state park in the United States
column9: was jointly founded by the states of Minnesota and Wisconsin in 1895
column10: and straddles the border of the two states immediately south of the city.

column1: At the 2010 census there were 976 people in 413 households
column3: in the city. The population density was 238.0 inhabitants per square mile (91.9/km2). There were 457 housing units at an average density of 111.5 per square mile (43.1/km2). The racial makeup of the city was 94.4% White
column8: and 1.4% from two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 0.5%.Of the 413 households 30.0% had children under the age of 18 living with them
column10: 9.7% had a female householder with no husband present
column11: 5.8% had a male householder with no wife present
column12: and 36.8% were non-families. 29.8% of households were one person and 8.9% were one person aged 65 or older. The average household size was 2.35 and the average family size was 2.89.

column1: The median age was 41.7 years. 23.7% of residents were under the age of 18; 6.7% were between the ages of 18 and 24; 23.5% were from 25 to 44; 30% were from 45 to 64; and 16.1% were 65 or older. The gender makeup of the city was 48.6% male and 51.4% female.
At the 2000 census there were 951 people in 369 households
column3: in the city.  The population density was 255.6 people per square mile (98.7/km2).  There were 386 housing units at an average density of 103.7 per square mile (40.1/km2).  The racial makeup of the city was 91.48% White
column8: and 0.74% from two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 0.74%.Of the 369 households 34.7% had children under the age of 18 living with them
column10: 12.2% had a female householder with no husband present
column11: and 32.8% were non-families. 26.0% of households were one person and 11.7% were one person aged 65 or older.  The average household size was 2.57 and the average family size was 3.11.

column1: Historic building in Taylor Falls include the Folsom House
column2: located in the historic Angel Hill District
column3: and the Taylors Falls Public Library. Taylors Falls also has the oldest public school in Minnesota

column1: The town has a ski and snowboard resort
column2: Wild Mountain that functions as a water park in the summer months. It is located 7.4 miles north of downtown Taylors Falls and 61 miles from Downtown Minneapolis.  The site has 26 ski hills spread over 100 acres of land. It also boasts as being the first ski resort to open in Minnesota every year. During the summer
column3: Wild Mountain also operates Taylors Falls Scenic Boat Tours. Leaving multiple times a day
column4: the tours range from 45-80 mins long. On the outskirts of Taylors Falls is Franconia Sculpture Park. It is an outdoor free sculpture garden covering 43-acres.

column1: Taylors Falls was the location where the main characters of Vilhelm Moberg's Swedish novel The Emigrants settled. It was adapted into a musical called Kristina från Duvemåla.
Taylors Falls at the Minnesota Historical Society.
